A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This movie didn't take into consideration the events of the previous movie (TFA).  Writing a movie before the last one is finished is a terrible idea\, but worse\, they don't know the whole arc of the series before it began.  Rian Johnson went out of his way to buck every trend for all the wrong reasons.  Tricking the audience with 'gotcha' moments leaves the audience less fulfilled.  All Fantasy asks you to suspend your disbelieve\, but once you break your own rules\, the suspension of disbelief is halted.  This is the least satisfying of all the SW movies and did almost nothing to advance the plot.
